item.title: BP Profits Miss Expectations
item.description: BP said it expected fourth-quarter oil, gas and low-carbon energy production to be broadly flat, with significantly lower realized refining margins, after it reported weaker-than-expected profits of $3.3 billion in the third quarter.

item.title: French Economy Slows Nearly to a Halt as Exports Slump
item.description: The French economy grew 0.1% between July and September, in line with forecasts, as production and exports slowed, suggesting tight monetary policy is squeezing industry in the country.

item.title: Vodafone to Sell Spanish Unit to Zegona Communications
item.description: Vodafone has agreed to sell its Spanish unit to Zegona Communications for at least €4.1 billion in cash and up to €900 million in redeemable preference shares.

item.title: China's Economy Shows Fresh Signs of Slowing
item.description: Surveys of factory orders and construction activity renewed concerns about the country’s growth.

item.title: BASF Swings to Loss After Sales Hurt by Lower Prices, Volumes
item.description: BASF said the global chemical industry is expected to stabilize in the fourth quarter but added that the macroeconomic outlook remained uncertain, after it swung to a loss and posted a 57% drop in underlying earnings in the third quarter.

item.title: Bankman-Fried was grilled by a federal prosecutor who was intent on poking holes through the FTX founder's claims that unfortunate management mistakes, not criminal activity, caused the crypto exchange's collapse.
item.description: Bankman-Fried was grilled by a federal prosecutor who was intent on poking holes through the FTX founder’s claims that unfortunate management mistakes, not criminal activity, caused the crypto exchange’s collapse.

item.title: Schools across the country are preparing to see their budgets shift from flush to strained as billions of dollars in pandemic aid runs out in less than a year.
item.description: Schools across the country are preparing to see their budgets shift from flush to strained as billions of dollars in pandemic aid runs out in less than a year.

item.title: Meta will stop showing ads to European teens as part of a plan announced to launch subscription-based versions of its social-media products to comply with the continent's regulations.
item.description: Meta will stop showing ads to European teens as part of a plan announced to launch subscription-based versions of its social-media products to comply with the continent’s regulations.

item.title: Ron DeSantis and Nikki Haley tied for second in an Iowa poll of likely GOP caucus attendees, while Donald Trump looks well positioned to win the state.
item.description: Ron DeSantis and Nikki Haley tied for second in an Iowa poll of likely GOP caucus attendees, while Donald Trump looks well positioned to win the state.

item.title: The Biden administration invoked emergency federal powers to assert oversight of powerful new AI systems, part of an executive order aimed at reining in the risks of the technology.
item.description: The Biden administration invoked emergency federal powers to assert oversight of powerful new AI systems, part of an executive order aimed at reining in the risks of the technology.

item.title: Stocks posted solid gains on Monday. The Dow rose 1.6%, while the S&P 500 and Nasdaq both added 1.2%.
item.description: Stocks posted solid gains on Monday. The Dow rose 1.6%, while the S&P 500 and Nasdaq both added 1.2%.

item.title: Police were warned last month that the gunman in the recent mass shootings in Maine threatened to "shoot up the drill center" where his Army reserves unit is based and that he had access to firearms.
item.description: Police were warned last month that the gunman in the recent mass shootings in Maine threatened to “shoot up the drill center” where his Army reserves unit is based and that he had access to firearms.

item.title: The UAW struck a tentative labor deal with GM, ending a six-week strike at the Detroit automakers that delivered the union's most decisive victory in decades.
item.description: The UAW struck a tentative labor deal with GM, ending a six-week strike at the Detroit automakers that delivered the union’s most decisive victory in decades.

item.title: The SEC sued SolarWinds, a software company victimized by Russian-linked hackers over three years ago, alleging it defrauded shareholders.
item.description: The SEC sued SolarWinds, a software company victimized by Russian-linked hackers over three years ago, alleging it defrauded shareholders.

item.title: A former Marvel executive said he has entrusted his stake in Disney to Nelson Peltz's Trian as it prepares to press the company for multiple board seats.
item.description: A former Marvel executive said he has entrusted his stake in Disney to Nelson Peltz’s Trian as it prepares to press the company for multiple board seats.

item.title: AT&T, T-Mobile and Verizon made more money from providing wireless services in the third quarter compared with the prior year as they added phone lines.
item.description: AT&T, T-Mobile and Verizon made more money from providing wireless services in the third quarter compared with the prior year as they added phone lines.

item.title: The U.K., France and other European countries have recorded a jump in antisemitic incidents since the Oct. 7 Hamas attack on Israel.
item.description: The U.K., France and other European countries have recorded a jump in antisemitic incidents since the Oct. 7 Hamas attack on Israel.

item.title: Google's Pichai sought to counter accusations of unfair dealings with Apple as he testified in his company's antitrust trial.
item.description: Google’s Pichai sought to counter accusations of unfair dealings with Apple as he testified in his company’s antitrust trial.

item.title: Airstrikes near Gaza's hospitals, which are overflowing with the sick and wounded and sheltering large numbers of civilians, have damaged buildings and disrupted operations.
item.description: Airstrikes near Gaza’s hospitals, which are overflowing with the sick and wounded and sheltering large numbers of civilians, have damaged buildings and disrupted operations.

item.title: Israeli tanks and infantry temporarily seized control of a strategic road linking the Gaza Strip's north and south, a major advance that appeared aimed at encircling the enclave's biggest population center, Gaza City.
item.description: Israeli tanks and infantry temporarily seized control of a strategic road linking the Gaza Strip’s north and south, a major advance that appeared aimed at encircling the enclave’s biggest population center, Gaza City.
